subject: Re: are suite classes of org.junit.runners.Suite run concurrently in multi-thread?
msgSnippet: Hi! As a rule of thumb, JUnit does not use threads. Cheers, Georg
messageBody:
Hi!

As a rule of thumb, JUnit does not use threads.

Cheers,
Georg


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "fan_of_fender" <fan_of_fender@...> wrote:
>
> Hi there,
> I have a test suite defined as follows:
> @RunWith(MainTestSuite.class)@SuiteClasses({ ATest.class, BTest.class,
> CTest.class})public final class MainTestSuite extends Suite {
> /** * @param klass class * @param builder builder * @throws
> InitializationError on error */ public MainTestSuite(final Class<?>
> klass, final RunnerBuilder builder) throws InitializationError {
> super(klass, builder); }
> }
> When I run the MainTestSuite in an Ant task, are the tests in
> ATest.class, BTest.class and CTest.class run concurrently in multiple
> threads? Thanks and please respond.
> Thanks,Fender
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
